question.title: Efficient Production
question.content:
Kevin has started a new production line. He has ‘N’ machines that can work simultaneously. All machines produce the same product but at a different speed. Time taken to produce one product by machines is given as an array ‘ARR’.

Kevin is new in the production business and so, he wants your help in producing ‘K’ products in the minimum possible time.

Input Format :

The first line contains a single integer ‘T’ representing the number of test cases. The 'T' test cases follow.

The first line of each test case will contain two space-separated integers ‘N’, and ‘K’ which denotes the number of machines and the total number of products, respectively.

The next line contains the ‘N’ space-separated integers, where ‘i-th’ element denotes the time taken by ‘i-th’ machine to produce one product.

Output Format :

For each test case, print an integer denoting the minimum time required to produce ‘K’ products. 

Output for every test case will be printed in a separate line.

Note :

You do not need to print anything; It has already been taken care of. Just implement the given function.

Constraints :

1 <= T <= 10
1 <= N <= 100000
1 <= K, ARR[i] <= 10^9

Where 'ARR[i]' denotes the 'ith' element of ARR.

Time limit: 1 sec

Sample Input 1 :

2
1 10
5 
2 3
1 2

Sample Output 1 :

50
2
Explanation Of sample input 1 :
In the first test case:
There is only one machine and it takes 5 units of time to produce one product. So, to produce 50 units it will take 50 units of time.

In the second test case:
After the first unit of time, the first machine will produce one product, total products = 1.
By the second unit of time, the first machine has produced 2 products and the second machine has produced 1 product. So, total products = 3 = 'K'.

Sample Input 2 :

2
6 7
11 11 11 11 11 11
5 5
1 1 1 1 1

Sample Output 2 :

22 
1

rephrased.body: A production line has 'N' machines, each producing the same product at varying speeds. Given an array 'ARR' representing the time each machine takes to produce one unit and a target number of products 'K', determine the minimum time required to produce at least 'K' products using all machines simultaneously.

testcases.explanation: One machine takes 5 units per product. To make 10 products, it will take 5 * 10 = 50 units of time.
Machine 1 produces 2 products in 2 units of time. Machine 2 produces 1 product in 2 units of time.  Total products are 2 + 1 = 3.
Each machine takes 11 units of time for one product.  At time 11, we have 6 products. At time 22, we have 12 products, which is greater than 7. Therefore the answer is 22.
Each machine takes 1 unit of time for one product. With 5 machines working simultaneously, they will produce 5 products in 1 unit of time.

hints: Can we iterate on time from 1 to 10 ^ 18 and check the number of products produced till this time?
If we can produce ‘K’ items in ‘i’ days then we can also do it in ‘i+1’ days also.
